item.title: “If You Love Me…”
item.itunes:author: Dr. George Thomasson
item.description: “As I study Scripture and the history of the church, I can only conclude that nothing short of genuine revival will spare us from God’s judgment. We need to be convicted, cleansed, and transformed by the power of the Holy Spirit so He can display His glory through us to a lost world that desperately needs His grace…God’s glory is the manifestation of His presence. Wherever God is acknowledged, worshiped, and obeyed, He will display His glory.” Del Fehsenfeld Jr.

item.title: Where Are You?
item.itunes:author: Dr. George Thomasson
item.description: It’s a joy to welcome evangelist Brent Crowe to the Bell Shoals Pulpit this morning. In addition to being a full time evangelist, Brent is currently serving as the Vice President for Student Leadership University. The desire of Brent’s heart is to see people realize that they have been set apart to the gospel of God and thus, in turn, they must set their lives apart in an effort to capture every moment in worshipful service to Him. Brent and his wife Christina have three children, Gabriel, Charis and Mercy. Please join me in giving Brent Crowe a warm Bell Shoals welcome!

item.itunes:author: Dr. H.D. McCarty
item.description: What an honor it is to welcome Dr. H.D. McCarty to the Bell Shoals pulpit this morning. Dr. McCarty had a 33 year career in the United States Air Force/Reserves/Air Guard, serving as both a pilot and chaplain. He retired as a Brigadier General (only the second Chaplain General in the 350 year history of the American Militia/National Guard).

item.title: A Tribute to The KING

item.description: Welcome to the culmination of our tenth-annual Global Outreach Celebration. It’s been a wonderful week having our Bell Shoals missionaries home celebrating alongside our local missionaries. What a joy it is to welcome back to the Bell Shoals pulpit, Pastor John Russell. John is a personal friend and is currently serving as Executive Pastor at Germantown Baptist Church in Germantown, Tennessee. John was instrumental in bringing our mission awareness and involvement to a new level during his tenure here at “The Fellowship of Encouragement” (1994-2006).

item.title: My Finances are Running Dry
item.itunes:author: Dr. George Thomasson
item.description: Today we begin a four-week sermon series entitled Under Pressure. During this series, we will discover what the Bible has to say about some of the top anxieties that people face. Statistics tell us that financial problems, guilt, fear of death, and feelings of insignificance are among the greatest of those anxieties. This morning we will address the issue of financial problems. Additional training on finances will also be offered during this semester of our Wednesday night Impact classes beginning this week.

item.title: All The Days of My Life
item.itunes:author: Dr. George Thomasson
item.description: It is with deepest regret that we inform you that our Pastor of Music and Worship, Simeon Nix, has passed into the presence of God. Simeon suffered an apparent heart attack at around 11:45 p.m. Saturday, August 16th, and was transported to the Brandon Hospital. Attempts to revive him were unsuccessful and he passed away around 1:15 a.m. Sunday morning. We appreciate your concern for Beth and the children and request that you would lift them up in prayer during this difficult time. We ask that you please respect their privacy and do not attempt to contact them at this time.
item.itunes:subtitle: A special service from August 17th, 2008

item.description: 1 Corinthians 1:26-29 - 26Brothers, think of what you were when you were called. Not many of you were wise by human standards; not many were influential; not many were of noble birth. 27But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong. 28He chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are, 29so that no one may boast before him.
